Burn Up ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ TV Movie.HDTV.AVI

Burn Up is a superior thriller co-produced between the UK and Canada that tackles environmental issues - chiefly global warming - and wraps them up in a cracking conspiracy thriller. The series begins with a mass murder in the Saudi Arabian desert and climaxes at an environmental summit in Calgary where it focuses on backroom efforts to get the Americans to sign up to Kyoto 2 at a the climate change conference in Calgary. It boils down to a choice - either the oil-based economy goes to hell and makes the crash of 1929 seem like a slow Friday, or everything goes to hell and life on Earth ceases to exist. 
This is a good drama with rich dialogue - it achieves what it sets out to do: present a story that engages and the viewer and delivers an important message.


Starring: Marc Warren, Rupert Penry-Jones, Bradley Whitford, Neve Campbell


IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt1105836/
IMDB Rating: 6.8/10  (141 votes)
What: A political thriller/drama set in the real-life context of climate change
Where first seen: BBC 2
When first seen: July 2008
Number of parts: Two
Duration: 1 hour and 25 minutes each part(total viewing approximately 3 hours)
Language: English
